a.title: Access Key:2. Skip to main content

div.p: I am very excited to inform our parents and community members about another recent accomplishment and recognition for the school district. For the fourth consecutive year, Grant Park School District has been named a “Top 100 NICHE School District” in Illinois. The company, which utilizes several variables when ranking public schools, releases the list each year. As I mentioned at our December board meeting, I could not be more proud of our students and staff members, as their commitment to excellence continues to amaze me.

As Spring approaches, our students continue to prepare for high stakes assessment. Students in grades 3-8 will be administered the IAR assessment later in March, which is required by the state of Illinois. Of course, our juniors will be taking the SAT in April, and the results are utilized in college placement decisions (and a wide array of other institutions as well). Historically, our students have done extremely well on the required assessments and that is one of the reasons our district is considered a “Top-Tier” school system in Illinois. If you would like more information about the required assessments, please contact your child’s building principal.

As we prepare for this upcoming semester, the staff will continue to focus on having a positive impact on our student body. At the beginning of the school year, I asked each staff member to remember a teacher or school employee who impacted his or her life in a positive way. Then, I asked each staff member to have that same impact on the students they serve. I am so excited for this next semester, as I have been privileged to watch our staff “work their magic” with many, many students in all grade levels. It is one of the key ingredients to our past and future success, as students are aware when adults care for their well-being.
As always, thank you for your continued support of Grant Park School District #6.

img.alt: Dr. John Palan, Superintendent Grant Park School District #6
Best High Schools US News Bronze 2015
Best High Schools US News Bronze 2017

div.p: Grant Park CUSD #6 does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, age, or disability in admission to its programs, services, or activities, in access to them, in treatment of individuals, or in any aspect of their operations. The lack of English language skills shall not be a barrier to admission or participation in the district’s activities and programs. Grant Park CUSD #6 also does not discriminate in its hiring or employment practices.
